summary: HCSM News ~ 'I don't want people to feel hopeless,' says lung-transplant patient pushing for donations to help others
title: HCSM News ~ 'I don't want people to feel hopeless,' says lung-transplant patient pushing for donations to help others
body:
Natalie Jarvis has been inundated with offers of help since speaking out last week about the significant financial costs faced by Atlantic Canadian patients who must move to Toronto for lung transplants, and now she’s asking people to help others in similar situations.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/nova-scotia-lung-transplant-toronto-1.5061400?cmp=rss

summary: N.S. woman sheds 100 kg, without joining a gym: 'You need to push'
title: N.S. woman sheds 100 kg, without joining a gym: 'You need to push'
body:
A Nova Scotia woman lost nearly 100 kilograms after vowing to transform her life, rather than end it. After contemplating suicide, she decided her weight shouldn’t hinder her anymore, and embarked on a journey that now sees her working as a fitness trainer.

Read more from CTV Health News https://www.ctvnews.ca/health/n-s-woman-sheds-100-kg-without-joining-a-gym-you-need-to-push-1.4342061

summary: HCSM News ~ 'It doesn't feel human': Students angry U of T not acknowledging campus suicides
title: HCSM News ~ 'It doesn't feel human': Students angry U of T not acknowledging campus suicides
body:
Dozens of students demanded action outside the halls of power at the University of Toronto on Monday, calling for the school to acknowledge a mental-health crisis on campus days after a suicide on campus.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/university-toronto-suicide-campus-1.5061809?cmp=rss

blog.description: A Nutritionist and Fitness Enthusiast. I deal in all things health and fitness with expert tips on weight loss, exercise, diets, workouts, bodybuilding and more

summary: 3 Food Labels Most  Likely to Fool New Dieters
title: 3 Food Labels Most  Likely to Fool New Dieters
body:
Remember when you first seriously determined to boost your wellness and also physique? You probably went right to your pantry to toss out all the crap and start purchasing healthy and balanced foods.

Unfortunately, the food companies have some misleading practices they make use of to mislead brand-new wellness candidates into assuming they’re eating right for their ‘simple diets’.

This means that it’s not sufficient to just intend on consuming healthy and balanced. You need to learn the language of when something is healthy vs. “pretend-healthy.” Right here are some guidelines to assist you recognize when a label indicates something aside from what you ’d expect.

3 Food Labels More than likely to Fool New Dieters

#1 “All Natural”

This is one of my favorites, due to the fact that it can indicate just about anything.

Here’s some food for thought:

If you’re a food producer … can you pump your chickens and also pigs with hormones and call the meat “all natural”? Yes.

Can you take laboratory additives and placed them in your “100% natural” juice product? Sure!

Can you feed your cows with manufacturing facility junk that pets would never eat in the wild?  Absolutely! Why not?

Since requirements are this loose for the “All Natural” tag, just what can you actually think about an item with that sticker?

Well, you’re probably not mosting likely to discover a piece of plastic or steel in your steak, yet that’s regarding it. “100% natural” is your assurance that your food is edible and not a plastic hamburger pulled out of Toys R Us.

If you appreciate just how all-natural your food is, check out the components and see if the item is held to any details criteria, such as “organic,” “grass-fed,” or “hormone/pesticide - complimentary.” Lots of people just wish they had diets that function, rather they are just perplexed and also fooled.

#2 “Per Serving”

It’s a remarkable day in The U.S.A. when you could feed a family of 17 with a solitary bag of potato chips.

You may have a concept of where I’m selecting this …

At some factor, food business found out that in some cases it’s difficult to boost a food’s nutritional profile without ruining preference or increasing production costs.

Their remedy was: “When making the tag, pretend they’re not that hungry.”

This is why you could get a little container of soft drink that states it has 2 to 3 portions … or as mentioned earlier, a bag of potato chips that thinks you just wish to have 5 chips each time. Frito-Lay has to really appreciate your discipline.

Luckily, there are a pair points that are compeling companies to at the very least take into consideration utilizing sensible serving sizes. For one, when you reduce the serving, vitamin content decreases in addition to everything else. More than that, the modern-day health activities have actually all promoted healthy protein, as well as business really don’t desire to surrender the “wellness points” for protein material and muscular tissue building.

You’ll just need to do the math when you look at the back of the label as well as be realistic on just how much you prepare on eating.

#3 “Zero Trans Fats”

If you have actually been in the health scene for any kind of time in any way, you know that all fats are not created equal.

Now what kind of fat is good for you is not constantly so clear. In between monounsaturated fats, polyunsaturated fats, saturated fats, Omega-3’s and Omega 6’s, it’s not always very easy to know which is the “favorite of the month” for nutritionists.

In fact … for the previous twenty years, we’ve had a pretty bipolar partnership with fats and also carbs in basic. As long as we “understand” now that all-natural fats benefit you as well as white bread carbohydrates misbehave, we really have no concept if nutritionists are mosting likely to state the opposite twenty years from now

But the one thing that’s corresponded considering that the dawn of time is that trans fats are NOT something you want in your body.

These are man-made fats that serve practically to maintain food long lasting longer as well as at variable temperature levels. The most common of the lot is partially hydrogenated oil.

Since they’re not safe in any quantities, the legislation commands that companies disclose the amount on the label.

Unfortunately, when the law was enforced, it permitted smaller sized amounts of trans fats in items to still count as “no grams.” The FDA figured that much less than half a gram coincided point as no grams. (Still waiting for a response from my Algebra teacher on that particular one.)

This gets back at worse when you think about that they’re truly claiming absolutely no grams “each offering,” and also when you divide that cake mix into sufficient micro-slices, you might toss in a whole extra pound of partly hydrogenated lard while still being certified with the FDA.

So whenever you see a tag saying “Zero grams trans fats” you could read that as “DEFINITELY ASSURED to have Trans Fats!” since if there were none at all, they would state “No Trans Fats,” which is the legal way of saying “Absolutely no trans fats and also we’re not bullshitting you this time.”

Always inspect making certain there are no partly hydrogenated oils and you need to be fine.

In the end, you need to be accountable as well as review the ingredients on just concerning every little thing. Also if something claims “No ingredients,” examine the components to see if there are additives. The food firm could be using a loophole in labeling laws, or it could be outright breaking labeling laws.

While you can merely ignore all stickers on the plan when shopping, I would certainly use them as ideas as opposed to rejecting them outright. See labels like “No included sugar,” “no preservatives” and also “100% fruit” as simply possibilities worth taking a closer take a look at. You usually only require to do this a few times anyhow as you resolve into a brand-new workout diet plan plan.

-Terry Asher

summary: Photos of man who had inner parts of his ears removed go viral
title: Photos of man who had inner parts of his ears removed go viral
body:
A Swedish body modification artist has garnered a lot of online attention after sharing pictures of a procedure in which the insides of a man’s ears were removed.

Read more from CTV Health News https://www.ctvnews.ca/lifestyle/photos-of-man-who-had-inner-parts-of-his-ears-removed-go-viral-1.4341093

summary: Healthy fats improve nerve function in obese mice
title: Healthy fats improve nerve function in obese mice
body:
Type 2 diabetes is associated with high-fat diets characterized by large amounts of saturated fats. In contrast, monounsaturated fatty acid-rich diets have been shown to have health benefits. summary: March Madness: 7 Potential First-Round Upsets to Watch in 2019 https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
title: March Madness: 7 Potential First-Round Upsets to Watch in 2019 https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
Every year there are a bunch of upsets in the NCAA Tournament, but the key is trying to find them. The things I like to look for are the squads that struggled down the stretch playing teams that have nothing to lose and are on a win streak themselves. A superstar would be nice and a veteran head coach who will navigate these 40 minutes well are also things to consider. Let’s take a look at some upsets to consider in the first round on Thursday and Friday.


Read the full story on Athlon Sports
